pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: See updated guidelines for Non-Disclosure agreements

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: Confidential relationships with our clients is of utmost importance. Training on updated guidelines for our non-disclosure agreements should be completed by the end of the month.

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: Learn about policy changes for Q4

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: For Q4, we will be following a new set of policy changes. Emails will be sent in the next few weeks with more information.

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: Review the new internal review process

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: As of this past year, we have updated our internal review process. Please reach out to your team lead for more information.
We have updated our review process for this upcoming quarter. Please review all of the following new updates.
When managing contracts for your department, be sure to follow our guidelines for a smooth approval process. For more questions, please reach out to any of the contract managers in your organization.
Every contract must go through a legal review. If you have not scheduled a review, please reach out to us so we can help you along the way.
Be sure to fulfill all documentation requirements when creating a contract. All contracts must be approved by your lead and align to the correct format.

A solution with SharePoint Syntex and Microsoft 365 components

This site template is a great way to start aggregating your contracts. Utilizing SharePoint Syntex and Microsoft 365 provides you with a framework to help you plan and create a solution that fits your unique business needs.

Check out a few ways in which you can extend your contracts management solution.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Tip 1 - Create models with SharePoint Syntex 

Creating a SharePoint Syntex document understanding model and applying it to a document library will identify and classify all contract documents from the many files you receive. You will also be able to quickly view several key elements in each of the contract files identified (for example, Client, Contractor, and Fee amount). 

View more information

Tip 2 - Use Microsoft Teams

Having a central Teams channel additionally helps stakeholders review, communicate, and manage contracts. For this purpose, you can leverage Microsoft Teams to set up a Teams channel.



View more information

Tip 3 - Use Power Automate

Create Power Automate flows for a list or document library to process your contracts that your SharePoint Syntex model identifies and classifies. You can create a Power Automate flow to do actions like:

  • After a contract has been classified by your SharePoint Syntex model, change the contract status to In review.
  • For approved contracts, post the contract information to a tab for payment processing.
  • For rejected contracts, notify the team for further analysis.

View more information
